body:
Summary

Tried to use `spack` locally on one of our office PCs

### Expected Result

A working spack installation

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ git clone https://github.com/spack/spack.git
$ cd spack 
$ . share/spack/setup-env.sh 
$ spack install zlib
==> Error: linux-debianstable-updates-x86_64 is an invalid arch spec
```

### Information on your system

I'm not too sure what exactly this system is but 
```
$ cat /etc/os-release 
PRETTY_NAME="Debian GNU/Linux buster/sid"
NAME="Debian GNU/Linux"
ID=debian
HOME_URL="https://www.debian.org/"
SUPPORT_URL="https://www.debian.org/support"
BUG_REPORT_URL="https://bugs.debian.org/"
```
seems to indicate an unstable release and it seems that spack doesn't want to play with it. I'm completely out of my depth here...

edit: Fixed the `os-release` output, I first took it from my local machine (which works)
title: linux-debianstable-updates-x86_64 is an invalid arch spec
